verses.roman:
svayaṁ ca tad-anujñātā
vṛṣṇayaḥ kṛṣṇa-devatāḥ
bhuktvopaviviśuḥ kāmaṁ
snigdha-cchāyāṅghripāṅghriṣu

synonyms: svayam—themselves; ca—and; tat—by Him (Lord Kṛṣṇa); anujñātāḥ—given permission; vṛṣṇayaḥ—the Vṛṣṇis; kṛṣṇa—Lord Kṛṣṇa; devatāḥ—whose exclusive Deity; bhuktvā—eating; upaviviśuḥ—sat down; kāmam—at will; snigdha—cool; chāyā—whose shade; aṅghripa—of trees; aṅghriṣu—at the feet.
translation: Then, with the permission of Lord Kṛṣṇa, their sole object of worship, the Vṛṣṇis ate breakfast and sat down at their leisure beneath trees that gave cooling shade.
